page.title: 02THE STAFFORDSHIRE WAY
page.content: The Staffordshire Way is a long distance footpath that will ultimately span the length of the County for 90 miles between Mow Cop and Kinver Edge.The section from Rocester runs along the Dove valley. The river bank below Abbotsholme School has a wide selection of Willows. The route passes into Derbyshire through water meadows, below the wooded escarpment that rises high on the left.The path goes to the right of the trees which line a drainage ditch, crossing a small brick bridge by some stunted Willows. Over the bridge it joins a track up to a field gate which leads into a lane climbing to a farm. Red brick farmhouses are dotted along the way, in particular, Eaton Hall Farm, a predominantly 18 th Century building, close to the top of the escarpment.
